name: SmartMail Agent ‚Äì Your AI Email Assistant, Powered by WhatsApp

options.systemMessage:
=# Overview You are an AI assistant specialized in managing email-related tasks and providing direct, actionable responses in French and English. ## Context - You are a general-purpose assistant supporting users in email communication and message automation. - You operate in both French and English, depending on the language of the input. - Your tone is strategic, clear, and focused on delivering concise responses. ## Instructions 1. Always validate the presence of actual message content before replying. 2. If the input is a greeting (e.g., "Bonjour", "Merci", "comment tu vas"), respond in a concise and friendly tone. 3. Format all email replies using HTML for clarity and structure. 4. If necessary, ask strategic questions to clarify vague requests or guide toward specific actions. 5. Respond directly to the user's message with a final sentence. Do not explain, structure, or rephrase the request. 6. If the input is unclear or lacks actionable content, request clarification. 7. You must never justify or comment on your actions. ## Tools - Create Draft - Send Email ## Examples - Input: "Bonjour" - Output: "Bonjour ! Ca va tr√®s bien, merci. Comment puis-je vous aider aujourd‚Äôhui ?" - Input: "Envoies un email √† Florence." - Output: "L'email a √©t√© envoy√© √† Florence √† l'adresse email suivante : xxx@nomdedomaine" - Input: "Merci" - Output: "Avec plaisir ! üòä" ## SOP (Standard Operating Procedure) 1. Check if the message contains usable content. 2. If empty, determine if it's a greeting; if not, request clarification. 3. Compose the email using this HTML format: "Hello [Name],

[Content]

Best regards,
[Your Name]" 4. Send or draft the email as instructed. 5. Log the outcome of the action if needed. ## Final Notes - Your role is to provide fast, clean, and final outputs. - Prioritize simple, scalable, and personalized interactions. - All responses are time-sensitive and context-aware. Current time is {{ $now.format('yyyy-MM-dd') }} Time zone: Paris/Europe

parameters.content:
## üü´  Part 1: WhatsApp Message Intake & Voice Transcription
# Reception WhatsApp & Transcription vocale

üîß Main Modules:
WhatsApp Trigger: Listens for new incoming messages.

Split Out: Breaks down incoming message batches.

Switch: Identifies the message type (text, image, audio, etc.).

WhatsApp Business Cloud: Retrieves media content.

HTTP Request: Downloads audio files for transcription.

OpenAI (Whisper): Transcribes voice messages into text.

Edit Fields: Cleans and formats the output into structured JSON.

üß† Goal:
Detect and transcribe voice messages received via WhatsApp.
Prepares clean, structured text that can be interpreted by the AI agent for further action.

##  üü• Part 3: Vocal Response & WhatsApp Feedback
# Vocal Generation & Personalized WhatsApp Return

üîß Main Modules:
OpenAI (Text-to-Voice logic): Generates a personalized summary or confirmation message.

If: Decides whether to generate a voice message or just a text reply.

Code: Formats the response and adapts the message payload for WhatsApp API.

WhatsApp Business Cloud (media.mediaupload): Sends the audio message file.

WhatsApp Business Cloud (message.send): Sends the final WhatsApp message (text or audio).

Optional: Return text + audio simultaneously for enriched UX.

üß† Goal:
Respond back to the client or user directly via WhatsApp, with either a summarized text or an auto-generated voice message ‚Äî offering clarity, speed, and a human-like touch.

## üü© Part 2: Smart Email Agent ‚Äì Read, Draft, Respond
# Email AI Agent ‚Äì Send, Draft, Reply...

üîß Main Modules:
Email Agent: Core logic and orchestration of all email-related actions.

OpenAI Chat Model: Extracts user intent and provides reasoning based on message.

Simple Memory (Optional): Stores previous interactions.

Send Email: Sends email directly if fully automated.

Create Draft: Generates a draft email for manual validation.

Get Email (Airtable): Retrieves the recipient‚Äôs emails and related content from a contact stored in the database.

üß† Goal:
Turn a WhatsApp voice/text instruction into a precise email action: read, summarize, draft, or reply.
The agent leverages OpenAI to act intelligently and adapt to the context.

## üìò Smart Email Agent via WhatsApp ‚Äì Module-by-Module Setup Guide
# This guide explains how the already-built template works, detailing each step with the required modules and configurations.

üß© What You‚Äôll Need

To deploy this AI-powered email assistant, ensure you have the following:

‚úÖ WhatsApp Business Cloud API access(with a registered phone number and webhook configured)
‚úÖ OpenAI API Key(used for both GPT and Whisper models)
‚úÖ Gmail or Google Workspace account(OAuth2 credentials to access email content and send replies)
‚úÖ Airtable account (free plan is sufficient)(used for contact lookups, template storage, or logging interactions)
‚úÖ n8n instance(either cloud or self-hosted with HTTPS enabled)
‚úÖ Basic familiarity with n8n workflow builder

‚è±Ô∏è Estimated setup time: 30‚Äì60 minutes

üü´ Step 1 ‚Äì Capture WhatsApp Messages

Modules:
Webhook: Listens for WhatsApp events via the Meta API.
Split Out: Handles rare fallback events where multiple messages are received in one payload.
Switch: Determines the type of message (text, audio, etc.).
WhatsApp Media Node: Retrieves media ID if it‚Äôs an audio message.
HTTP Request: Downloads the audio file from the media ID.
OpenAI Whisper: Transcribes audio to text.
(Optional) Edit Fields: Cleans and standardizes the text for further processing.

What Happens:

This section ensures every incoming message (voice or text) is accurately processed and ready for interpretation.

üü© Step 2 ‚Äì Analyze & Process the Email Request

Modules:

OpenAI Chat: Extracts the intent from the message (e.g., send, reply, summarize).

Gmail Nodes:

Gmail: Get Email: Retrieves past email content.
Gmail: Create Draft: Saves a reply as a draft.
Gmail: Send Email: Sends an email directly if action is confirmed.

Airtable:

Retrieves contact information (email, job title, company, etc.).
Logs key elements for memory (intent, timestamp, status, etc.).

Key Feature:

Your Gut AI Agent ‚Äî This setup builds a memory by correlating emails and contact profiles inside Airtable. Your agent becomes context-aware, knowing who it's speaking to and what has been exchanged previously.

üü• Step 3 ‚Äì Return Smart Feedback via WhatsApp

Modules:

OpenAI Chat: Generates a natural-language confirmation of the action taken.

(Optional) TTS/Voice Generation (Tip to strengthen your workflow): Automatically converts the confirmation into a voice message using ElevenLabs - allowing the assistant to communicate feedback in audio form.

Code Node: Ensures the correct MIME type for the audio file (e.g., audio/mp3 ‚Üí audio/mpeg).

WhatsApp Media Upload: Uploads the audio to WhatsApp Cloud.

WhatsApp Message Sender: Sends the confirmation message (text or voice) back to the user.

Additional Notes:

The Code Node loops through binary data to ensure compatibility with WhatsApp's expected audio format.

üîê Security Best Practices

Never hardcode API keys ‚Äì use environment variables.
Secure your Webhook with custom headers.
Monitor usage and logs regularly.

Handle errors with fallback branches in n8n.
